metadata.title: CVE-2017-15098 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Invalid json_populate_recordset or jsonb_populate_recordset function callsin PostgreSQL 10.x before 10.1, 9.6.x before 9.6.6, 9.5.x before 9.5.10,9.4.x before 9.4.15, and 9.3.x before 9.3.20 can crash the server ordisclose a few bytes of server memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
libecpg6 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpq5 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.10-0ubuntu0.16.04').
